comments:
Build ID: M20060628-1325

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Use Ant build that creates a target folder that is visible in Eclipse project.
2. While Ant build happens edit something in your project and save.
3. After saving, the Validation tries to validate the files in the target folder. Eclipse finds out that something was changed and it is out of sync. After that a NullPointerException occurs and Eclipse crashes. But I'am unable to start Eclipse completely after that happen, because it shows only the splash screen and crashes again until I delete most of my settings in Workspace.



More information:
java.version=1.6.0_02
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

For my problem with starting Eclipse I found a workaround. 

After crash happens, delete .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime .
Start Eclipse. It isn't able to restore the old views, so exit eclipse.
Restore deleted .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime folder and start eclipse.
Hari- this seems like a really fringe case... is this even supported?  If not, can you close as invalid?
Shouldn't this go to the jsf team?

Please review. I don't think the steps to repro are relevant.
(In reply to comment #1)
> For my problem with starting Eclipse I found a workaround. 
> After crash happens, delete .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime .
> Start Eclipse. It isn't able to restore the old views, so exit eclipse.
> Restore deleted .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime folder and start
> eclipse.

I am able to reproduce to exceptions, but not the crash of Eclipse.  Does the problem reproduce if you disable JSF validation first? (Windows->Preferences->Validation, uncheck JSP Semantic Validator (JSF)).

Created an attachment (id=74393)
Patch to avoid NPE in ResourceBundleMapSource when the underlying file won't load

Further changes are planned to decouple managed maps from the resource properties to avoid lifecycle problems.

I'm only able to reproduce this problem, if I don't disable the JSF validation. 
After the exception occurs, eclipse wasn't reacting(waiting 5-10 minutes) so I killed it. After a eclipse restart I only see the splash screen and after 80-90% the progress bar stops and the java and eclipse processes doesn't do anything more(waited again for at least 15 minutes). If I try my "workaround" the project is completely rebuild, the next time eclipse was able to start.

Are you able to reproduce the problem in WTP 2.0?  While I am able to reproduce the NPE and have created a patch to avoid this issue, I don't get a crash.  This makes me wonder if there is a secondary issue that won't be addressed by fixing the NPE.

Created an attachment (id=75448)
Improved patch to add out-of-sync and !exists() checks on bundles
I have committed changes that resolve the NPE and resource out-of-sync (CoreException)'s.  I can't reproduce the crash, so I don't if it's fixed.  I will leave as assigned for now.
I'm going to mark fixed and verify in M201RC1.
I'm going to mark fixed and verify in M201RC1.
Frank-Michael, can yo please verify this fix in 2.0.1?
